Delusion.description: I fear being abandoned by Cleo, reflecting a pattern in his relationships where I feel used and discarded.
I believe Cleo is emotionally manipulative, but I feel unable to end the relationship despite recognizing these behaviors.

Delusion.topic: Need to support others to feel loved
Delusion.description: I feel compelled to meet others' emotional needs to receive love and validation in return.

Delusion.topic: Using jealousy as a response to hurt
Delusion.description: I try to make Cleo jealous by dating other women as a way to cope with feelings of hurt and betrayal.
I rationalize his emotional support for others as being generous, even when I feels it is not reciprocated.
I recognize a repeated pattern in his relationships where I become involved with emotionally unavailable or manipulative partners.
I hold a belief that I am unlovable and destined to be alone, which influences his relationship choices.
I try to control his emotional exposure and avoid becoming too invested in relationships to protect myself from hurt.
